00003 package Value::Union;
00004 my $pkg = 'Value::Union';
00005 
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Convert a value to a union of intervals.  The value must be
00011 #      a list of two or more Interval, Union or Point objects.
00012 #      Points will be converted to intervals if they are length 1 or 2.
00013 #
00014 sub new {
00015   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00016   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00017   if (scalar(@_) == 1 && !ref($_[0])) {
00018     my $x = Value::makeValue($_[0],context=>$context);
00019     if (Value::isFormula($x)) {
00020       return $x if $x->type =~ m/Interval|Union|Set/;
00021       Value::Error("Formula does not return an Interval, Set or Union");
00022     }
00023     $x = $self->promote($context,$x); $x = $self->make($context,$x) unless $x->type eq 'Union';
00024     return $x;
00025   }
00026   my @intervals = (); my $isFormula = 0;
00027   foreach my $xx (@_) {
00028     next if $xx eq ''; my $x = Value::makeValue($xx,context=>$context);
00029     if ($x->isFormula) {
00030       if ($x->type =~ m/Point|List/ && $x->length == 2 &&
00031       $x->typeRef->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number') {
00032     $x->{tree} = $x->Item("List")->new($x->{tree}{equation},$x->{tree}{coords},$x->{tree}{isConstant},
00033                        $context->{parens}{interval},$x->typeRef->{entryType},'(',')');
00034       }
00035       if ($x->type eq 'Union') {push(@intervals,map {new Parser($context,$_)} ($x->{tree}->makeUnion))}
00036       elsif ($x->isSetOfReals) {push(@intervals,$x)}
00037       else {Value::Error("Unions can be taken only for Intervals or Sets")}
00038       $isFormula = 1;
00039     } else {
00040       if ($x->classMatch('Union')) {push(@intervals,$x->value)}
00041       elsif ($x->isSetOfReals) {push(@intervals,$x)}
00042       elsif ($x->canBeInUnion)
00043     {push(@intervals,$x = $context->Package("Interval")->new($context,$x->{open}||"(",$x->value,$x->{close}||")"))}
00044       else {Value::Error("Unions can be taken only for Intervals or Sets")}
00045     }
00046   }
00047   Value::Error("Empty unions are not allowed") if scalar(@intervals) == 0;
00048   return $self->formula(@intervals) if $isFormula;
00049   my $union = form($context,@intervals);
00050   $union = $self->make($context,$union) unless $union->type eq 'Union';
00051   return $union;
00052 }
00053 
00054 #
00055 #  Make a union or interval or set, depending on how
00056 #  many there are in the union.
00057 #
00058 sub form {
00059   my $context = shift;
00060   return $_[0]->inContext($context) if scalar(@_) == 1;
00061   return $context->Package("Set")->new($context) if scalar(@_) == 0;
00062   my $union = $context->Package("Union")->make($context,@_);
00063   $union = $union->reduce if $union->getFlag('reduceUnions');
00064   return $union;
00065 }

00067 #
00068 #  Return the appropriate data.
00069 #
00070 sub typeRef {
00071   my $self = shift;
00072   return Value::Type($self->class, $self->length, $self->data->[0]->typeRef);
00073 }

00081 #
00082 #  Recursively convert the list of intervals to a tree of unions
00083 #
00084 sub formula {
00085   my $self = shift;
00086   my $formula = $self->Package("Formula")->blank($self->context);
00087   $formula->{tree} = recursiveUnion($formula,Value::toFormula($formula,@_));
00088   return $formula
00089 }
00090 sub recursiveUnion {
00091   my $formula = shift; my $right = pop(@_);
00092   return $right if (scalar(@_) == 0);
00093   return $formula->Item("BOP")->new($formula,'U',recursiveUnion($formula,@_),$right);
00094 }
00095 
00096 #
00097 #  Try to promote arbitrary data to a set
00098 #
00099 sub promote {
00100   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00101   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00102   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00103   $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00104   return $context->Package("Set")->new($context,$x,@_) if scalar(@_) > 0 || Value::isReal($x);
00105   return $x->inContext($context) if ref($x) eq $class;
00106   $x = $context->Package("Interval")->promote($context,$x) if $x->canBeInUnion;
00107   return $self->make($context,$x) if $x->isSetOfReals;
00108   Value::Error("Can't convert %s to an Interval, Set or Union",Value::showClass($x));
00109 }

00116 #
00117 #  Addition forms unions
00118 #
00119 sub add {
00120   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00121   $l = $self->make($l) unless $l->type eq 'Union';
00122   $r = $self->make($r) unless $r->type eq 'Union';
00123   form($self->context,$l->value,$r->value);
00124 }
00125 sub dot {my $self = shift; $self->add(@_)}

00127 #
00128 #  Subtraction can split intervals into unions
00129 #
00130 sub sub {
00131   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00132   $l = $l->reduce; $l = $self->make($l) unless $l->type eq 'Union';
00133   $r = $r->reduce; $r = $self->make($r) unless $r->type eq 'Union';
00134   form($self->context,subUnionUnion($l->data,$r->data));
00135 }
00136 
00137 #
00138 #  Which routines to call for the various combinations
00139 #    of sets and intervals to do subtraction
00140 #
00141 my %subCall = (
00142   SetSet => \&Value::Set::subSetSet,
00143   SetInterval => \&Value::Set::subSetInterval,
00144   IntervalSet => \&Value::Set::subIntervalSet,
00145   IntervalInterval => \&Value::Interval::subIntervalInterval,
00146 );
00147 
00148 #
00149 #  Subtract a union from another by running through both lists
00150 #  and subtracting everything in the second list from everything
00151 #  in the first.
00152 #
00153 sub subUnionUnion {
00154   my ($l,$r) = @_;
00155   my @union = (@{$l});
00156   foreach my $J (@{$r}) {
00157     my @newUnion = ();
00158     foreach my $I (@union)
00159       {push(@newUnion,&{$subCall{$I->type.$J->type}}($I,$J))}
00160     @union = @newUnion;
00161   }
00162   return @union;
00163 }
00164 
00165 #
00166 #  Sort the intervals lexicographically, and then
00167 #    compare interval by interval.
00168 #
00169 sub compare {
00170   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00171   if ($self->getFlag('reduceUnionsForComparison')) {$l = $l->reduce; $r = $r->reduce}
00172   $l = $self->make($l) unless $l->type eq 'Union';
00173   $r = $self->make($r) unless $r->type eq 'Union';
00174   my @l = $l->sort->value; my @r = $r->sort->value;
00175   while (scalar(@l) && scalar(@r)) {
00176     my $cmp = shift(@l) <=> shift(@r);
00177     return $cmp if $cmp;
00178   }
00179   return scalar(@l) - scalar(@r);
00180 }

00187 #
00188 #  Reduce unions to simplest form
00189 #
00190 sub reduce {
00191   my $self = shift;
00192   return $self if $self->{isReduced};
00193   my @singletons = (); my @intervals = ();
00194   foreach my $x ($self->value) {
00195     if ($x->type eq 'Set') {push(@singletons,$x->value)}
00196     elsif ($x->{data}[0] == $x->{data}[1]) {push(@singletons,$x->{data}[0])}
00197     else {push(@intervals,$x->copy)}
00198   }
00199   my @union = (); my @set = (); my $prevX;
00200   @intervals = (CORE::sort {$a <=> $b} @intervals);
00201   ELEMENT: foreach my $x (sort {$a <=> $b} @singletons) {
00202     next if defined($prevX) && $prevX == $x; $prevX = $x;
00203     foreach my $I (@intervals) {
00204       my ($a,$b) = $I->value;
00205       last if $x < $a;
00206       if ($x > $a && $x < $b) {next ELEMENT}
00207       elsif ($x == $a) {$I->{open} = '['; next ELEMENT}
00208       elsif ($x == $b) {$I->{close} = ']'; next ELEMENT}
00209     }
00210     push(@set,$x);
00211   }
00212   while (scalar(@intervals) > 1) {
00213     my $I = shift(@intervals); my $J = $intervals[0];
00214     my ($a,$b) = $I->value; my ($c,$d) = $J->value;
00215     if ($b < $c || ($b == $c && $I->{close} eq ')' && $J->{open} eq '(')) {
00216       push(@union,$I);
00217     } else {
00218       if ($a < $c) {$J->{data}[0] = $a; $J->{open} = $I->{open}}
00219               else {$J->{open} = '[' if $I->{open} eq '['}
00220       if ($b > $d) {$J->{data}[1] = $b; $J->{close} = $I->{close}}
00221               else {$J->{close} = ']' if $b == $d && $I->{close} eq ']'}
00222     }
00223   }
00224   my $context = $self->context;
00225   push(@union,@intervals);
00226   push(@union,$context->Package("Set")->make($context,@set)) unless scalar(@set) == 0;
00227   return $context->Package("Set")->new($context) if scalar(@union) == 0;
00228   return $union[0]->inContext($context) if scalar(@union) == 1;
00229   return $self->make(@union)->with(isReduced=>1);
00230 }
00231 
00232 #
00233 #  True if a union is reduced.
00234 #
00235 #  (In scalar context, is a pair whose first entry is true or
00236 #   false, and when true the second value is the reason the
00237 #   set is not reduced.)
00238 #
00239 sub isReduced {
00240   my $self = shift;
00241   return 1 if $self->{isReduced};
00242   return $self->{data}[0]->isReduced if ($self->length == 1);
00243   my @I; my @S; my $Sn = 0; my $error;
00244   foreach my $x (@{$self->{data}})
00245     {if ($x->type eq 'Interval') {push(@I,$x)} else {$Sn++; push(@S,@{$x->{data}})}}
00246   my $U = $self->make(@I); my $sU = $U->sort;
00247   my $S = $self->Package("Set")->new($self->context,@S);
00248   foreach my $i (0..$sU->length-2) {
00249     my ($x,$y) = ($sU->{data}[$i],$sU->{data}[$i+1]);
00250     if ($x->intersects($y)) {$error = "overlaps"; last}
00251     if (($x + $y)->reduce->type ne 'Union') {$error = "uncombined intervals"; last}
00252   }
00253   $error = "overlaps in sets" if !$error && $S->intersects($U);
00254   $error = "uncombined sets" if !$error && $Sn > 1 && !$self->getFlag('reduceSets');
00255   $error = "repeated elements in set" if !$error && !$S->isReduced;
00256   return $error eq "" unless $error && wantarray;
00257   return (0,$error);
00258 }

00260 #
00261 #  Sort a union lexicographically
00262 #
00263 sub sort {
00264   my $self = shift;
00265   $self->make(CORE::sort {$a <=> $b} $self->value);
00266 }

00270 #  Tests for containment, subsets, etc.
00271 #
00272 
00273 sub contains {
00274   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00275   return ($other - $self)->isEmpty;
00276 }
00277 
00278 sub isSubsetOf {
00279   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00280   return $other->contains($self);
00281 }

00283 sub isEmpty {
00284   my $self = (shift)->reduce;
00285   $self->type eq 'Set' && $self->isEmpty;
00286 }

00288 sub intersect {
00289   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00290   return $self-($self-$other);
00291 }
00292 
00293 sub intersects {
00294   my $self = shift; my $other = $self->promote(@_);
00295   return !$self->intersect($other)->isEmpty;

00303 sub pdot {
00304   my $self = shift;
00305   my $text = $self->stringify;
00306   $text = '('.$text.')' if $self->length > 1;
00307   return $text;
00308 }

00310 sub string {
00311   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift; shift; shift; my $prec = shift;
00312   my $op = ($equation->{context} || $self->context)->{operators}{'U'};
00313   my @intervals = ();
00314   foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {
00315     $x->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00316     push(@intervals,$x->string($equation))
00317   }
00318   my $string = join($op->{string} || ' U ',@intervals);
00319   $string = '('.$string.')' if $prec > ($op->{precedence} || 1.5);
00320   return $string;
00321 }
00322 
00323 sub TeX {
00324   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift; shift; shift; my $prec = shift;
00325   my $op = ($equation->{context} || $self->context)->{operators}{'U'};
00326   my @intervals = ();
00327   foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {push(@intervals,$x->TeX($equation))}
00328   my $TeX = join($op->{TeX} || $op->{string} || ' U ',@intervals);
00329   $TeX = '\left('.$TeX.'\right)' if $prec > ($op->{precedence} || 1.5);
00330   return $TeX;
00331 }
